STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 17, 2023
Lisa Marie Davis
IOSCO/ALCONA COUNTY DHHS
2145 E US 23,
EAST TAWAS, MI, 48730-9422
Re: License #: CP350201199
Dear Lisa Marie Davis:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
10/03/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at .
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
An agency’s medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(c) A physical examination
One of the three foster child records reviewed indicated the youth did not have a current
physical examination as required. The most recent physical examination documented was
dated 6/06/2018. The identified date of placement of this youth was 05/12/2023. It was
reported at the time of the exit conference this youth had an examination scheduled but
was a no show for the appointment and has been uncooperative in attending a subsequent
appointment.
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
(f) The provision of a dental examination and any
treatment required for each child who is 4 years of age
and older, including both of the following:
(i) A dental examination within 12 months before
placement or a new dental examination shall be
completed not more than 90 calendar days after
placement.
(ii) A dental reexamination shall be obtained at least
every 18 months, unless a greater frequency is indicated.
Two of the three foster child records reviewed indicated the youth did not have a dental
examination completed as required. In the first record the youth had a placement date of
05/12/2023 and the most recent dental examination was dated 05/29/2019. In the second
2

record the youth does have a current dental dated 1/10/2023 but this examination should
have been completed by 11/3/2022 to establish compliance. This youth had a placement
date of 08/03/2022.
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
The DHS-1105, Family Team Meeting Report, is used to capture
family demographics, FTM logistical information, needs,
strengths, action steps, safety concerns and the safety plan, and
any recommendations made for the family during the FTM. The
DHS-1105, Family Team Meeting Report, must be completed for
every FTM.
Two of the three foster child records reviewed did not include the required documentation
for compliance with this policy. In the first record the youth had a documented FTM on
05/16/2023 but there was no 1105 completed for this FTM as required. In the second
example there was no documentation that an FTM had been completed for the time period
09/2/2023-11/30/2023.
This is a repeat noncompliance for the renewal evaluation completed 08/15/2022.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• None
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• None
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
agency submitted a corrective action plan for the renewal evaluation completed
8/15/2022. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that review were Rule
324(4)(a), Rule 418(5), Rule 504(1)(2), Rule 507(1), Rule 509(3)(n), Rule
510(1)(a), Rule 511 (1)(a)(b)(c)(d), MISEP 4.22, FOM 801-3, and FOM 722-06 B.
The only area identified as a repeat noncompliance as a part of this interim
review is FOM 722-06 B.
3

Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was a review of the agency's progress in
implementing and completing the approved corrective action plan. It also provided
a review of the agency's ability to meet the key performance indicators.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Staff comments
were positive and did not indicate any areas of concern.
The youth interviews with the analyst were positive and indicated appropriate
support and services are being provided.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of the agency determined the licensing and youth records are
being maintained consistent with compliance for licensing rules.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Comments by caregivers and youth were positive indicating appropriate support and
services are being provided. There was one safety alert. A relative caregiver had a
pond on the property and did not have door alarms or safety equipment as needed.
The family received door alarms and a life ring on 04/25/2023. They were
subsequently installed and picture documentation was received to confirm
compliance. The CAP for the safety alert was approved 5/11/2023.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
10/13/2023

Mark Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
